meanings.definition: Each of the two parts forming the arms of the cross shape, projecting at right angles from the nave of a church.
meanings.sent1: The transepts of the church were beautifully decorated with stained glass windows.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the transepts to give the church a unique cross shape.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons found a cozy spot to nest in the transepts of the church.
meanings.sent4: The transepts of knowledge and creativity intersected in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streamed through the transepts, illuminating the entire church.

meanings.definition: A part of a building that extends at right angles to the main part.
meanings.sent1: The office building had transepts that housed the executive offices.
meanings.sent2: The new addition to the house included a spacious transept for the dining area.
meanings.sent3: The children loved playing hide-and-seek in the building's transepts.
meanings.sent4: The transept of the museum led visitors to the ancient artifacts section.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze flowed through the transept, providing a refreshing break from the main building.
